intro: Dichapetalum chlorinum, commonly known as the yellowwood tree, is a deciduous tree native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Nyssaceae and is characterized by its smooth, light gray bark and alternate, simple leaves that are elliptical in shape. The tree produces small, greenish-yellow flowers in clusters, followed by orange-red berries that are toxic to humans and animals. Its botanical features make it an important species in forest ecosystems, particularly in moist, well-drained soils.
